info.title: Customer Demo API Suite v2.2.0
info.description:
This API Suite contains a complete list of Panviva's API offerings for the [Customer Demo](https://customerdemo.supportpoint.com/) environment.

**Content APIs** help perform resource related operations within Panviva products, e.g. `document`, `folder`, `file`, `container`, `image`.

**Live APIs** exclusively enable real-time communications with online users on our client application.

Our APIs follow the JSON API specification 1.0.

get.description: Use this echo API to validate connectivity.
get.summary: Use this echo API to validate connectivity.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A document unique identifier, `Docment ID`.  If a document is a translated document, this value represents `Internal ID` or `IID` in Panviva API v1.

parameters.name: fields[document]
parameters.description:
Request the API to return only resource specified fields inside `attributes`, `relationships` and/or `meta` section of the resource object. The value of the fields parameter is a comma-separated list that refers to the name(s) of the fields to be returned. Field name is case sensitive.
```
https://api-staging.panviva.com/v2/demo/document/343?fields[document]=name,version,containers
```
\* *Sparse fieldsets (```fields[TYPE]```) parameter can be applied to any resource ```type```.*

parameters.name: fields[container]
parameters.description:
Request the API to return only resource specified fields inside `attributes`, `relationships` and/or `meta` section of the resource object. The value of the fields parameter is a comma-separated list that refers to the name(s) of the fields to be returned. Field name is case sensitive.
```
https://api-staging.panviva.com/v2/demo/container/343-229-0-119?fields[container]=name
```
\* *Sparse fieldsets ```fields[TYPE]``` parameter can be applied to any resource ```type```.*

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Include related resources from the relationships into the ```included``` section of the response. The value of the include parameter is a comma-separated list of relationships path.
```http
https://api-staging.panviva.com/v2/demo/document/343?include=containers
```

200.description:
The operation is successful and return with the requested resource.

An example of a successful response may be seen under **Sample** below. See **Schema** for a detailed explanation of the response body.

400.description: `400 Bad Request` The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. The client should not repeat the request without modifications.

404.description: `400 Not Found` The server has not found anything matching the request URI.

405.description: `405 Method Not Allowed` The method specified in the request is not allowed for the resource identified by the request URI. The response must include an `Allow` header containing a list of valid methods for the requested resource.

406.description:
`406 Not Acceptable` The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request.
If accept headers is specified, ```application/vnd.api+json``` must be the only media type.

415.description:
`415 Unsupported Media Type` The server is refusing to service the request because the entity of the request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
The only supported media type is ```application/vnd.api+json```.

422.description: `422 Unprocessable Entity` The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

500.description: `500 Internal Server Error` The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

get.description:
Return a collection of `container` identifier that links to the  `document` resource in the `containers` relationship.  The `containers` relationship links the document details with its contents, previously knowned as section/task/sub-section.
- Any resource linkage with `meta.children` indicates that it has sub-level `cotnainer`(s) within this relationship.  This `container` represents section in Panviva API 1.0.
- Any resource linkage with `meta.parent` indicates its sub-level with another `container` within this relationship.  This `container` represents task/sub-section in Panviva API 1.0.  The `parent` value is the `id` of the parent container, previously known as section.
- Any resource linkage with `meta.taskFlow` indicates that this `container` has been marked as `task flow` and its should represent the flow of the specified `container` in this relationship.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A document unique identifier, `Docment ID`.  If a document is a translated document, this value represents `Internal ID` or `IID` in Panviva API v1.

200.description:
The operation is successful and return with the requested resource identifier collection.

405.description: `405 Method Not Allowed` The method specified in the request is not allowed for the resource identified by the request URI. The response must include an `Allow` header containing a list of valid methods for the requested resource.

406.description:
`406 Not Acceptable` The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request.
If accept headers is specified, ```application/vnd.api+json``` must be the only media type.

415.description:
`415 Unsupported Media Type` The server is refusing to service the request because the entity of the request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
The only supported media type is ```application/vnd.api+json```.

422.description: `422 Unprocessable Entity` The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

500.description: `500 Internal Server Error` The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

get.description: Return a collection of `container` resource that links to the `document`.  This refers to section/task/sub-section content in Panviva API 1.0.
get.summary: Get related resources from document's containers relationship.

get.description:
Return a collection of `folder` resource that matched the search filter.  The current supported filter keyword are as following.
- `root` Get resource root folder.  Current supported resource is `document`.  See `filter[root]` for more details.

parameters.name: filter[root]
parameters.description:
Get root `folder` resource.  The current supported value is `document`.
```http
https://api-staging.panviva.com/v2/demo/folder?filter[root]=document
```

get.description: Return a collection of `folder`, `document`, and/or `file` identifier that links to the  `folder` resource in `children` relationship.  This include all the translations.  See `filter[language]` to filter out a particular language.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A resource unique identifier.

parameters.name: filter[language]
parameters.description:
Filter the resource collection to a particular language.  Currently only support `folder.children` relationship.
- `default[languageCode]` returns the resource collection with a fallback mechanism to original language if the preferred language does not exist.  Language value is in Language-Region (RFC 5646), e.g., 'en-AU', 'en-US'.
```http
https://api-staging.panviva.com/v2/demo/folder?filter[language]=default[en-AU]
```

200.description:
The operation is successful and return with the requested resource identifier collection.

An example of a successful response may be seen under **Sample** below. See **Schema** for a detailed explanation of the response body.

400.description: `400 Bad Request` The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. The client should not repeat the request without modifications.

404.description: `400 Not Found` The server has not found anything matching the request URI.

405.description: `405 Method Not Allowed` The method specified in the request is not allowed for the resource identified by the request URI. The response must include an `Allow` header containing a list of valid methods for the requested resource.

406.description:
`406 Not Acceptable` The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request.
If accept headers is specified, ```application/vnd.api+json``` must be the only media type.

415.description:
`415 Unsupported Media Type` The server is refusing to service the request because the entity of the request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
The only supported media type is ```application/vnd.api+json```.

422.description: `422 Unprocessable Entity` The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

500.description: `500 Internal Server Error` The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

get.description: Return a paginated array of resources matching the given search term.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: The word or phrase to be searched for.

parameters.name: page[offset]
parameters.description: The pagination offset to denote the number of initial search results to skip. page[offset] of 100 and page[limit] of 10 would return records 101-110, for example.

parameters.name: page[limit]
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Must be an integer between 0 and 1000.

200.description:
The operation is successful and return with a list of paginated search results, regardless of whether any matches were found.

An example of a successful response may be seen under **Sample** below. See **Schema** for a detailed explanation of the response body.

400.description: `400 Bad Request` The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. The client should not repeat the request without modifications.

404.description: `400 Not Found` The server has not found anything matching the request URI.

405.description: `405 Method Not Allowed` The method specified in the request is not allowed for the resource identified by the request URI. The response must include an `Allow` header containing a list of valid methods for the requested resource.

If accept headers is specified, ```application/vnd.api+json``` must be the only media type.

500.description: `500 Internal Server Error` The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

location.description: Section/task/sub-section ID inside the document.  Default is '-1'.

userId.description: User ID.  Request must contains either userId or userName.

username.description: User name. Request must contains either userId or userName.

maximiseClient.description: When `false` or not specified, if Panviva Desktop is minimised, it will pop up briefly before minimising again. When `true` the client will maximise and stay maximised.

attributes.name: Marvel Cinematic Universe (Films)
attributes.description: The Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is an American media franchise and shared universe that is centered on a series of superhero films.

meta.body: Captain America: Civil War

Doctor Strange

 

 

 

 

 

Mr. Doctor?

origin.description: An ID of the original document in this relationship.

attributes.name: Lorem ipsum dolor
attributes.description: Suspendisse consectetur dignissim est, vel tincidunt enim.
attributes.snippet: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce volutpat, nunc id luctus condimentum, diam elit elementum justo, ut malesuada diam purus eu est. Mauris aliquam tincidunt diam in dapibus. Nullam nunc sapien, efficitur vel purus sed, rutrum consectetur enim. Aliquam erat volutpat. Ut rhoncus ligula nec congue semper. Nam et leo erat.

attributes.name: The films
attributes.description: Films that make a grown man squeal by the memories of his childhood

origin.description: An ID of the original folder in this relationship.

meta.body: Captain America: Civil War

id.description: A document unique identifier. If a document is a translated document, this value refers to `Internal ID` or `IID` in Manager.

language.description: A document language represent in 'Language-Region' (RFC 5646).  For example, 'en-AU', 'en-US'.

release.description: A release number of a document.

released.description: A boolean value indicates whether the document is relesed.

percentage.description: A percentage completed of the document.

layout.description: A designed representation of the document.

reusableContent.description: A boolean value indicates whether the document is a reusable content.

keywords.description: A document keywords used in search.

cshKeywords.description: A document keywords used in CSH search.

training.description: A additional training attributes for training document.

hidden.description: A boolean value indicates whether the document is to be hidden from search.

locked.description: A boolean value indicates whether the document is currently locked (possibly from being edited).

updatedDate.description: A datetime when a document was last updated.

createdDate.description: A datetime when a document was created.

allOf.description: A collection of document content.  Previously called `section`, `task`, and `sub-section` in Panviva API 1.0.
A collection of the translated and/or original documents.
A document HTML content. Previously called section, task, and sub-section in Panviva API 1.0.

language.description: A folder language represent in 'Language-Region' (RFC 5646).  For example, 'en-AU', 'en-US'.

hidden.description: A boolean value indicates whether the folder is to be hidden from search.

allOf.description: A collection of the translated and/or original folders.

language.description: A file language represent in 'Language-Region' (RFC 5646).  For example, 'en-AU', 'en-US'.

release.description: A release number of a file.

released.description: A boolean value indicates whether the file is relesed.

percentage.description: A percentage completed of the file.

keywords.description: A file keywords used in search.

cshKeywords.description: A file keywords used in CSH search.

hidden.description: A boolean value indicates whether the file is to be hidden from search.

updatedDate.description: A datetime when a file was last updated.

createdDate.description: A datetime when a file was created.

content.description: Base64 string of the file content

contentType.description: An image content-type, e.g. `image/png`, `image/jpeg`. **(All images are converted to `image/png` on upload.)**

content.description: Base64 string of the image content

items.description: A custom label attached to the resource. Previously called `custom properties` in Panviva API 1.0.

value.description: Tag value can be one of the following primitive data types; `string`, `number`, `date`.

links.description: A link object that related to the resource.

attributes.description: An attributes object representing some of the resources data.

relationships.description: A relationships object describing relationships between the resource and other resources.

meta.description: A non-standard meta-information about a resource.

relationship.description: A relationships object describing relationships between the resource and other resources.

self.description: A link for the relationship itself.

meta.description: A non-standard meta-information about a relationship.

data.description: A resource linkage representing in an array of resource identifier objects for to-many relationship.

links.description: A link object that related to primary data.

self.description: A link that generated the current response.

meta.description: A non-standard meta-information about a response.

included.description: An array of resource objects that are related to the primary data.

errors.title: Internal Server Error
errors.detail: An unknown server-side error has occurred. Please try again later or contact support.
